paper_abstract: This work is a study of DES-like ciphers where the bitwise exclusive-or (XOR) operation in the underlying Feistel network is replaced by an arbitrary group operation. The authors construct a two-round simplified version of DES that contains all the DES components and show that its set of encryption permutations is not a group under functional composition, it is not a pure cipher, and its set of encryption permutations does not generate the alternating group. They present a non-statistical proof that for n <= 4 the set of n-round Feistel permutations over an arbitrary group do not constitute a group under functional composition.
paper_title: A Simplified and Generalized Treatment of DES-Related Ciphers
